quizzes.question:
What is the output of this code?
arr = [5, [9, 4, 6], [8]]
puts arr[1][0]
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Nested Arrays[/h1]

Arrays can contain other arrays. These are called [b]nested arrays[/b].
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="rb" codeId="1032"]arr = [ [1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6] ]
puts arr[1][2]
# outputs 6[/code]
The arr array contains two arrays. So, arr[1][2] accesses the second array's third element, which is 6.
[note]There can be multiple levels of nesting.[/note]
